title: Quellenverzeichnis - Digital Health Playbook
text:
AMA (Hg.) (2018): Telehealth Implementation Playbook. Online verfügbar unter
[https://www.ama-assn.org/system/files/2020-04/ama-telehealth-playbook.pdf](https://www.ama-assn.org/system/files/2020-04/ama-telehealth-playbook.pdf), zuletzt geprüft am 04.01.22.
AOK (Hg.) (2021): Digitale Gesundheitsanwendungen: Definition, Abgrenzung, Verordnung. Online verfügbar unter
[https://www.aok.de/gp/aerzte-psychotherapeuten/digitale-gesundheitsanwendungen](https://www.aok.de/gp/aerzte-psychotherapeuten/digitale-gesundheitsanwendungen), zuletzt geprüft am 04.01.22.
Barsom, Esther Z.; Jansen, Marilou; Tanis, Pieter J.; van de Ven, Anthony W. H.; van Oud-Alblas, Marjolein Blussé; Buskens, Christianne J. et al. (2021a): Video consultation during follow up care: effect on quality of care and patient-and provider attitude in patients with colorectal cancer. In: Surgical endoscopy 35 (3), S. 1278–1287.
BfArM (Hg.) (2021): DiGA-Leitfaden. Online verfügbar unter
[https://www.bfarm.de/DE/Medizinprodukte/Aufgaben/DiGA/_node.html](https://www.bfarm.de/DE/Medizinprodukte/Aufgaben/DiGA/_node.html), zuletzt geprüft am 04.01.22.
Cao, W., Wan, Y., Tu, H. et al. (2011), A web-based appointment system to reduce waiting for outpatients: A retrospective study. In: BMC Health Serv Res 11, 318.
Cleveland Clinic (Hg.) (2020): Cleveland Clinic COVID-19 Response – Digital Health Playbook. Online verfügbar unter
[https://my.clevelandclinic.org/-/scassets/files/org/landing/preparing-for-coronavirus/covid-response-digital-health-playbook.ashx?la=en](https://my.clevelandclinic.org/-/scassets/files/org/landing/preparing-for-coronavirus/covid-response-digital-health-playbook.ashx?la=en), zuletzt geprüft am 04.01.22.
Di Lenarda, Andrea; Casolo, Giancarlo; Gulizia, Michele Massimo; Aspromonte, Nadia; Scalvini, Simonetta; Mortara, Andrea et al. (2017): The future of telemedicine for the management of heart failure patients: a Consensus Document of the Italian Association of Hospital Cardiologists (ANMCO), the Italian Society of Cardiology (SIC) and the Italian Society for Telemedicine and eHealth (Digital SIT). In: European Heart Journal Supplements 19 (suppl_D), D113-D129.
Dr. Johannes Mayer, Dr. Björn Meyer, Dr. Oliver Bültmann (19.06.2020): Klinischer Studienbericht „velibra“. Wirksamkeit des webbasierten Programms „velibra“ bei Angststörungen in der medizinischen Grundversorgung: Ergebnisse einer randomisierten, kontrollierten klinischen Studie. Online verfügbar unter
[https://de.velibra.com/downloads/Studienbericht_velibra_Berger_2017_inkl_Append_2020-06-26.pdf](https://de.velibra.com/downloads/Studienbericht_velibra_Berger_2017_inkl_Append_2020-06-26.pdf), zuletzt geprüft am 04.01.22.
Dubner, Sergio; Auricchio, Angelo; Steinberg, Jonathan S.; Vardas, Panos; Stone, Peter; Brugada, Josep et al. (2012): ISHNE/EHRA expert consensus on remote monitoring of cardiovascular implantable electronic devices (CIEDs). In: Europace 14 (2), S. 278–293.
gematik (Hg.) (2022): Startseite. Online verfügbar unter
[https://www.gematik.de/](https://www.gematik.de/), zuletzt geprüft am 01.03.22.
Habibi, M.R.M., Mohammadabadi, F., Tabesh, H. et al. (2019), Effect of an Online Appointment Scheduling System on Evaluation Metrics of Outpatient Scheduling System: a before-after MulticenterStudy. In: J Med Syst 43, 281.
Hahn, Erik (2019): Telemedizin–Das Recht der Fernbehandlung: Ein Überblick für Ärzte, Zahnärzte, Psychotherapeuten, Heilpraktiker und Juristen: Springer.
Hindricks, Gerhard; Varma, Niraj; Kacet, Salem; Lewalter, Thorsten; Søgaard, Peter; Guédon-Moreau, Laurence et al. (2017): Daily remote monitoring of implantable cardioverter-defibrillators: insights from the pooled patient-level data from three randomized controlled trials (IN-TIME, ECOST, TRUST). In: European heart journal 38 (22), S. 1749–1755.
Hoch, Paula; Arets, Jana (2021): Die Videosprechstunde als Modell der Akzeptanz digitaler Leistungen im Gesundheitswesen. In: B&G Bewegungstherapie und Gesundheitssport 37 (04), S. 151–156.
Karen S. Rheuban (2015): Telemedicine. Facilitate Access to Care for Your Patients. Hg. v. AMA STEPS Forward. Online verfügbar unter,
[https://edhub.ama-assn.org/steps-forward/module/2702689](https://edhub.ama-assn.org/steps-forward/module/2702689), zuletzt geprüft am 04.01.22.
Li, Cabbee T. L.; Hung, Goris K. N.; Fong, Kenneth N. K.; Gonzalez, Pablo Cruz; Wah, Shu-hong; Tsang, Hector W. H. (2020): Effects of a home-based occupational therapy telerehabilitation via smartphone for outpatients after hip fracture surgery: A feasibility randomised controlled study. In: Journal of Telemedicine and Telecare
Liu G., Zhou L., Wu J. (2018) What Affects Patients’ Online Decisions: An Empirical Study of Online Appointment Service Based on Text Mining. In: Chen H., Fang Q., Zeng D., Wu J. (eds) Smart Health. ICSH 2018. In: Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol 10983. Springer, Cham.
Lorenz, Noah; Heim, Eva; Roetger, Alexander; Birrer, Eva; Maercker, Andreas (2019): Randomized controlled trial to test the efficacy of an unguided online intervention with automated feedback for the treatment of insomnia. In: Behavioural and cognitive psychotherapy 47 (3), S. 287–302.
Lunde, Pernille; Bye, Asta; Bergland, Astrid; Grimsmo, Jostein; Jarstad, Even; Nilsson, Birgitta Blakstad (2020): Long-term follow-up with a smartphone application improves exercise capacity post cardiac rehabilitation: A randomized controlled trial. In: European journal of preventive cardiology 27 (16), S. 1782–1792.
Marx, Gernot; Rossaint, Rolf; Marx, Nikolaus (2021): Telemedizin: Grundlagen und praktische Anwendung in stationären und ambulanten Einrichtungen: Springer Berlin/Heidelberg.
Parmar, V., Large, A., Madden, C., & Das, V. (2009). The online outpatient booking system’Choose and Book’improves attendance rates at an audiology clinic: a comparative audit. In: Journal of Innovation in Health Informatics, 17(3), 183-186.
Pöttgen, Jana; Moss-Morris, Rona; Wendebourg, Janina-Maria; Feddersen, Lena; Lau, Stefanie; Köpke, Sascha et al. (2018): Randomised controlled trial of a self-guided online fatigue intervention in multiple sclerosis. In: Journal of Neurology, Neurosurgery & Psychiatry 89 (9), S. 970–976.
Ricci, Renato Pietro; Morichelli, Loredana; Quarta, Laura; Sassi, Anna; Porfili, Antonio; Laudadio, Maria Teresa et al. (2010): Long-term patient acceptance of and satisfaction with implanted device remote monitoring. In: Europace 12 (5), S. 674–679.
Schnelzer, A.; Grab, D.; Sander, G.; Steinburg, S. Pildner von; Daumer, M.; Scholz, M.; Schneider, K. T.M. (2005): CTG–Tele–Monitoring im Bereich der Übertragung. In: Zeitschrift für Geburtshilfe und Neonatologie 209 (S 2), PO_4_10.
Sellars, Hannah; Ramsay, G.; Sunny, Ann; Gunner, Charlotte K.; Oliphant, Raymond; Watson, Angus J. M. (2020): Video consultation for new colorectal patients. In: Colorectal Disease 22 (9), S. 1015–1021.
The Office of the National Coordinator for Health Information Technology (Hg.) (2020): Health IT Playbook. Online verfügbar unter
[https://www.healthit.gov/playbook/](https://www.healthit.gov/playbook/), zuletzt geprüft am 04.01.22.
van den Heuvel, J. F.M.; Teunis, C. J.; Franx, A.; Crombag, NMTH; Bekker, M. N. (2020a): Home-based telemonitoring versus hospital admission in high risk pregnancies: a qualitative study on women’s experiences. In: BMC pregnancy and childbirth 20 (1), S. 1–9.
van den Heuvel, Josephus F. M.; Ayubi, Samira; Franx, Arie; Bekker, Mireille N. (2020b): Home-Based Monitoring and Telemonitoring of Complicated Pregnancies: Nationwide Cross-Sectional Survey of Current Practice in the Netherlands. In: JMIR mHealth and uHealth 8 (10)
Varma, Niraj; Love, Charles J.; Michalski, Justin; TRUST Investigators; Epstein, Andrew E. (2021): Alert-based ICD follow-up: a model of digitally driven remote patient monitoring. In: Clinical Electrophysiology 7 (8), S. 976–987.
Zill, Jördis M.; Christalle, Eva; Meyer, Björn; Härter, Martin; Dirmaier, Jörg (2019): The effectiveness of an Internet intervention aimed at reducing alcohol consumption in adults: Results of a randomized controlled trial (Vorvida). In: Deutsches Ärzteblatt International 116 (8), S. 127.
Zwerenz, Rüdiger; Becker, Jan; Knickenberg, Rudolf J.; Siepmann, Martin; Hagen, Karin; Beutel, Manfred E. (2017): Online self-help as an add-on to inpatient psychotherapy: efficacy of a new blended treatment approach. In: Psychotherapy and psychosomatics 86 (6), S. 341–350.
Zwisler, Ann-Dorthe; Norton, Rebecca J.; Dean, Sarah G.; Dalal, Hayes; Tang, Lars H.; Wingham, Jenny; Taylor, Rod S. (2016): Home-based cardiac rehabilitation for people with heart failure: A systematic review and meta-analysis. In: International journal of cardiology 221, S. 963–969.
